thread.title: Shock resignation of pet business CEO
thread.title_full: Shock resignation of pet business CEO

author: news.com.au
title: Shock resignation of pet business CEO
text:
SHARES in Greencross have been pounded after the resignation of the vet clinic and pet shop operator's chief executive.
JEFFREY David is stepping down immediately and will be replaced by chief financial officer Martin Nicholas.
Greencross shares closed down 95 cents, or 13.51 per cent, at $6.08. Mr David is the founder of Mammoth Pet, the owner of Petbarn and Animates stores, and became chief executive of Greencross when it took control of Mammoth in January 2014. He has been on the board of Greencross since 2007. Chairman Stuart James said Mr David had expressed his desire to step down following the integration of Mammoth and West Australian pet retailer City Farmers into the Greencross business. Mr Nicholas will be paid an annual salary of $780,000, and bonuses of up to half that each year. Meanwhile, Greencross said its like-for-like sales had grown 6.3 per cent in the first eight weeks of the new financial year.
